CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Post-Event Feedback stage positioned above or below the Fan Engagement stage?
SRP.A: The Post-Event Feedback stage is positioned {below} the Fan Engagement stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {logarithmic} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Merchandise Purchase?
VE.A: The value of stage Merchandise Purchase is {146}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Fan Engagement?
VE.A: The value of stage Fan Engagement is {362}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Ticket Purchase, with a value of {1143}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Merchandise Purchase, with a value of {146}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Event Attendance to stage Fan Engagement?
SC.A: Decreased by {288} Participants from stage Event Attendance to stage Fan Engagement.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 896? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 506? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Fan Engagement} stage has {362}, the {Post-Event Feedback} stage has {176}, the {Merchandise Purchase} stage has {146}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 161 and 896? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Event Attendance} stage has {650}, the {Fan Engagement} stage has {362}, the {Post-Event Feedback} stage has {176}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Event Attendance to Fan Engagement, or from stage Ticket Purchase to Event Attendance?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Ticket Purchase} to {Event Attendance} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Fan Engagement to Post-Event Feedback, or from stage Ticket Purchase to Event Attendance?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Ticket Purchase} to {Event Attendance} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Fan Engagement to Post-Event Feedback, from stage Event Attendance to Fan Engagement, or from stage Ticket Purchase to Event Attendance?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Ticket Purchase} to stage {Event Attendance} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Ticket Purchase} and {Event Attendance} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Post-Event Feedback} and {Merchandise Purchase} stages.
